name: NPR
text:
U.S. stores and restaurants got a boost in June, with retail sales jumping 7.5%. But that came before a new surge in coronavirus cases prompted renewed shutdowns in several states.
https://t.co/qy285mv48N

name: NPR
text: RT @OPB: Federal officers have been using unmarked vehicles to detain Portland protesters since at least July 14. The administration says officers are protecting federal property, but interviews show they're also detaining people nowhere near it. https://t.co/RKsRLvQL52

name: NPR
text:
In its second federal execution this week after a 17-year hiatus, the U.S. government has put to death Wesley Purkey. The Supreme Court cleared the way, 5-4, for the execution to proceed early Thursday.
https://t.co/JDT7dsMlPj

name: NPR
text:
RT @npratc: Four states have agreed to share driver's license records to help the Trump administration produce citizenship data. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, we look at how this data could be used for redrawing voting districts.
https://t.co/ZyJ5KZYcA0

name: NPR
text:
Ireland is delaying its next phase of reopening, which was set for July 20. Prime Minister Micheál Martin said bars will stay closed and other restrictions will remain in place until Aug. 10.
https://t.co/1pqRFKfNuq

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration has mandated that hospitals report COVID-19 data to a new system run by HHS instead of the CDC's existing one. 

The change sparked concerns that it was hobbling the CDC's ability to gather and analyze crucial data amid a pandemic. https://t.co/Nb30XmuUtp

name: NPR
text:
U.S. oil producers are grappling with prolonged low oil prices and the uncertainty created by the pandemic.

"I do believe that the golden age of the mega deals in oil and gas may be gone," an analyst says. 
https://t.co/tGB0M2OIXd

name: NPR
text:
The Twitter hack is raising questions about the vulnerability of a platform that is a major communications channel for companies, news outlets and politicians — including Trump, who often uses it to announce public policy.
https://t.co/gbHr2De34g

name: NPR
text:
The Australian state of Victoria has set a new one-day record for coronavirus infections, with 317 new cases. The nationwide death toll is up to 113.
https://t.co/Wq8FNojGg4
